name: Agda
description: Dependently typed functional programming language and proof assistant. It is an interactive system for writing and checking proofs.

name: Astropy
description: The Astropy Project is a community effort to develop a common core package for Astronomy in Python and foster an ecosystem of interoperable astronomy packages.

name: AVRDUDE
description: Download/upload/manipulate the ROM and EEPROM contents of AVR microcontrollers.

name: AXIOM
description: FriCAS: derivative of the powerful AXIOM-CAS

name: bc
description: Arbitrary precision calculator language.

name: Binary
description: Simple app to convert between different hexadecimal and binary numbers.

name: BT747
description: The swiss army knife for MTK GPS dataloggers.

name: calc
description: Arbitrary precision console calculator.

name: Chemtool
description: GTK-based program for drawing chemical structural formulas.

name: Deepin Calculator
description: Easy to use calculator for Deepin desktop.

name: dfu-util
description: Device firmware update (DFU) USB programmer.

name: Digital
description: Interactive simulator similiar to the discontinued Logisim. Features Karnaugh maps, logic tables, FSM editor, VHDL export and more, written in Java.

name: FFTW
description: A Fast Fourier Transform library for computing discrete Fourier transforms. Used for a wide variety of numerical applications, which includes spectral methods.

name: Fityk
description: Curve fitting and data analysis application, predominantly used to fit analytical, bell-shaped functions to experimental data.

name: FOX Calculator
description: Simple desktop calculator.

name: FreeCAD
description: Parametric 3D CAD modeler based on OpenCascade, Coin3D, Qt, and Python with features such as macro recording, workbenches and the ability to run as a server.

name: Fritzing
description: Easy to use program to draw good-looking circuit diagrams, and also create schematics and PCBs.

name: Gaia Sky
description: An open source 3D universe simulator with support for more than a billion objects

name: galculator
description: GTK-based scientific calculator.

name: GAP
description: Computer algebra system for computational discrete algebra with particular emphasis on computational group theory.

name: Genius
description: Advanced calculator including a mathematical programming language.

name: GeoGebra
description: Dynamic mathematics software with interactive graphics, algebra and spreadsheet

name: gephi
description: Gephi is an open-source network analysis and visualization software package written in Java.

name: Gis Weather
description: Customizable weather forecast desktop widget.

name: GNU Radio
description: Software development toolkit that provides signal processing blocks to implement software radios.

name: Gnuplot
description: Command-line program that can generate 2D and 3D plots of functions, data, and data fits.

name: Gpredict
description: Real-time satellite tracking and orbit prediction application.

name: GPSBabel
description: Reads, writes, and manipulates GPS waypoints, tracks, routes in a variety of formats.

name: gpsd
description: Service daemon that monitors one or more GPSes or AIS receivers attached to a host computer through serial or USB ports, making all data on the location/course/velocity of the sensors available to be queried on TCP port 2947 of the host computer.

name: GpsPrune
description: View, edit and convert coordinate data from GPS systems.

name: GPX Viewer
description: Simple tool to visualize tracks and waypoints stored in a gpx file.

name: GPXSee
description: GPS log file viewer and analyzer.

name: Gqrx
description: Software defined radio receiver implemented using GNU Radio and the Qt GUI toolkit.

name: Gramps
description: Genealogy program, which helps you track your family tree.

name: Graphs
description: Tool to plot and manipulate data.

name: Graphviz
description: The established tool for displaying smallish graphs in 2D.

name: GRASS GIS
description: Geospatial data management and analysis, image processing, graphics/maps production, spatial modeling and visualization.

name: GTKWave
description: Fully featured GTK-based wave viewer which reads LXT, LXT2, VZT, FST, and GHW files as well as standard Verilog VCD/EVCD files and allows their viewing.

name: iverilog
description: Icarus Verilog compiler and simulation tool (slower but older than Verilator).

name: JOSM
description: Main editor for OpenStreetMap written in Java.

name: Julia
description: High-level, high-performance dynamic language for technical computing.

name: KiCad
description: Software suite for electronic design automation (EDA) that facilitates the design of schematics for electronic circuits and their conversion to PCB (printed circuit board).

name: kosmindoormap
description: Indoor cartography, levels by levels of buildings, mainly Train station, and Airport buildings. Based on OSM data.

name: KStars
description: Planetarium application that provides an accurate graphical simulation of the night sky, from any location on Earth, at any date and time. It is included in KDE Edu.

name: LabPlot
description: Free software data analysis and visualization application, similar to SciDAVis.

name: LeoCAD
description: CAD program for creating virtual LEGO models. It has an easy to use interface and currently includes over 10,000 different pieces created by the LDraw community.

name: LibreCAD
description: A 2D CAD application based on Qt5. Forked from QCAD Community Edition.

name: Marble Behaim
description: Viewer for the oldest existent globe of the Earth made by Martin Behaim and collaborators around 1492.

name: Marble Maps
description: Vector and GNSS navigation system, with  Modular turn-by-turn car, foot, and bike navigation system (adapted to Linux Mobile).

name: MATE Calc
description: Calculator for the MATE desktop environment.

name: Mathics
description: A free CAS for symbolic mathematical computations which uses Python as its main language. It aims at achieving a Mathematica-compatible syntax and functions. It relies mostly on Sympy for most mathematical tasks and, optionally, Sage for more advanced functionality.

name: matplotlib (PyLab)
description: Collection of Python modules (pyplot, numpy, etc.) used for scientific calculations.

name: Maxima
description: Maple/Mathematica-like computer algebra system.

name: Merkaartor
description: OpenStreetMap editor.

name: ngspice
description: The established Linux circuit simulator. Open source successor of the spice3f5 code. Has the most versatile user interface; supporting scripting within the circuit descriptions, use through an interpreter, as a C library, through tcl or various external wrappers (e.g., Python).

name: Octave
description: MATLAB-like language and interface for numerical computations.

name: OffRoad
description: Offline vector map display ported from OsmAnd.

name: OpenSCAD
description: A 3D CAD modeler that uses a textual, programmatic approach to creating and manipulating objects.

name: ParaView
description: Interactive data visualization tool built using VTK that can scale across distributed computer hardware.

name: PARI/GP
description: Computer algebra system designed for fast computations in number theory.

name: platformio
description: Collaborative platform for embedded development, embedded development, with debugger, unit testing, code analysis. Default IDE is VSCode, but can be used by Atom, Eclipse, Emacs Qt Creator, Vim and several other IDE. Core CLI utils.

name: Prolog
description: Prolog is a logic programming language associated with artificial intelligence and computational linguistics.

name: PrusaSlicer
description: Slicer by Prusa Research. A fork of Slic3r. Aimed at their printers but supports other brands as well. Open source.

name: PSPP
description: Free SPSS implementation.

name: PulseView
description: Logic analyzer, oscilloscope and MSO GUI.

name: PyMOL
description: Open-source molecular visualization system that can produce high quality 3D images of small molecules and biological macromolecules, such as proteins.

name: Python Data Analysis Library (pandas)
description: Providing high-performance, easy-to-use data structures and data analysis tools with Python programming language.

name: PyTorch
description: An open source machine learning framework that accelerates the path from research prototyping to production deployment.

name: qalc
description: Command-line calculator and equation solver with fault-tolerant parsing, constant recognition and units.

name: QCAD
description: A 2D CAD application based on Qt. Supports the DFX and HPGL standard file formats, and optionally the DWG format through a proprietary plugin.

name: QGIS
description: Geographic Information System (GIS) that supports vector, raster & database formats.

name: QMapShack
description: Plan your next outdoor trip.

name: qucs-s
description: Electronics circuit simulator that gives you the ability to set up a circuit with a GUI and simulate it. Fork of qucs that uses external, better, programs to do actual simulation.

name: R
description: Software environment for statistical computing and graphics.

name: Railway
description: Lets you look up travel information for many different railways, all without needing to navigate through different websites.

name: RDKit
description: A collection of cheminformatics and machine-learning software written in C++ and Python.

name: Rink
description: A unit conversion tool and library written in rust. It can be used for physics and engineering calculations, as well as dimensionality analysis.

name: RKWard
description: Frontend for the statistical language R.

name: ROOT
description: Data analysis program and library (originally for particle physics) developed by CERN.

name: RStudio
description: A powerful and productive IDE for R written in Qt.

name: SageMath
description: Mathematics software system, that combines many existing open-source packages into a common Python interface. Alternative to Magma, Maple, Mathematica and Matlab.

name: sdcc
description: Small Device C Compiler, appropriate for various 8-bit microcontrollers and microprocessors including those made by or based on Intel MCS51, Maxim/Dallas, DS80C390, Freescale/Motorola HC08, Zilog Z80, Padauk, ST Microelectronics STM8, MOS 6502, and WDC 65C02. Suite contains compiler, assembler, linker, preprocessor, various simulators, debuggers, etc.

name: Singular
description: Computer algebra system for polynomial computations, with special emphasis on commutative and non-commutative algebra, algebraic geometry, and singularity theory.

name: SolveSpace
description: Powerful 3D CAD constraint-based parametric modeler with simple mechanical simulation capabilities.

name: SpeedCrunch
description: Fast, high precision and powerful cross-platform calculator.

name: Stellarium
description: Beautiful 3D planetarium that uses OpenGL to render a realistic sky in real time.

name: stlink
description: Open source [https://www.st.com/en/microcontrollers-microprocessors.html STM32 MCU] programming toolset for ST microcontrollers.

name: Tensorflow
description: An end-to-end open source machine learning platform.

name: Valuta
description: Simple application for converting currencies.

name: Verilator
description: A Verilog/SystemVerilog simulator, performs lint code-quality checks, compile to threaded C++ code for simulation.

name: Viking
description: GTK 2 application to manage GPS data.

name: VTR
description: Verilog to Routing, Open Source CAD Flow for FPGA ResearchVerilog to Route.

name: wxMaxima
description: Graphical user interface for Maxima being a powerful computer algebra system.

name: xcalc
description: Scientific calculator for X with algebraic and reverse polish notation modes.

name: Xcas
description: User interface to Giac, a free, basic computer algebra system.

name: Xfce Weather Panel Plugin
description: Weather forecast plugin for the Xfce4 panel.
